A 36-year-old man comes to the office to discuss a skin rash on his shoulders and upper chest The patient first noticed the rash 2 months ago while vacationing at a beach resort. The rash has worsened progressively and is associated with mild pruritus, but he has no other associated symptoms. The patient is a road construction worker and often works in hot, humid areas. Past medical history is notable for seasonal allergies and childhood asthma. He does not use tobacco or alcohol. Skin examination findings are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 54-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to a week of progressive headaches and confusion. He was treated for viral esophagitis 6 months ago and Pneumocystis pneumonia 2 months ago. The patient is lethargic and oriented to person and place only. CT scan of the head shows a mildly increased ventricle size but no other abnormalities. Lumbar puncture reveals an elevated opening pressure and cerebrospinal fluid analysis shows moderately increased protein concentration and pleocytosis. The latex agglutination test is positive for soluble polysaccharide antigen. Light microscopy of this patient‘s cerebrospinal ?uid is most likely to reveal which of the following?
White Piedra is caused by

Find the true statement regarding Ehrlichia

options.label: A
options.text: It forms an inclusion body called a morula in the cytoplasm of infected cells.

options.label: B
options.text: It is transmitted primarily by mosquito bite.

options.label: C
options.text: It forms beta-hemolytic colonies on blood agar.

options.label: D
options.text: Its most common clinical presentation is acute meningitis.

questions.correct_answer: A. It forms an inclusion body called a morula in the cytoplasm of infected cells.

A 24 year old women take Live attenuated influenza vaccine two days before came to your clinic regarding planning pregnancy. What will be your advice in this case
Each of the following statements concerning the vaccine for the Measles except

options.label: A
options.text: The vaccine contains live, attenuated virus.

options.label: B
options.text: The vaccine should not be given at the same time as the mumps vaccine because the immune system cannot respond to two viral antigens given at the same time.

options.label: C
options.text: Virus in the vaccine contains only one serotype.

options.label: D
options.text: The vaccine should not be given prior to 15 months of age because maternal antibodies can prevent an immune response.

questions.correct_answer: B. The vaccine should not be given at the same time as the mumps vaccine because the immune system cannot respond to two viral antigens given at the same time.

questions.text: Guillain-Barre syndrome is a complication associated with
Find the correct statement regarding Mycoplasma pneumoniae

options.label: A
options.text: Amoxicillin is the drug of choice for pneumonia caused by this organism.

options.label: B
options.text: Antibody in a patient’s serum will agglutinate human red blood cells at 4°C, but not at 37°C.

options.label: C
options.text: Gram stain of the sputum reveals small gram-negative rods.

options.label: D
options.text: It is an obligate intracellular parasite that can only grow within human cells in the clinical laboratory.

questions.correct_answer: B. Antibody in a patient’s serum will agglutinate human red blood cells at 4°C, but not at 37°C.
